<entry name="Aircraft0Description" value="Gaseous fuel is ionized and fed into an acceleration chamber containing magnetic and electrical fields, where particles are propelled by the Lorentz force out through the exhaust chamber. This produces an extremely high specific impulse with an exhaust velocity of up to and beyond 110,000 meters per second, allowing smaller airborne vessels with a limited power source to evolve into fast and agile fighters.
"Fight on and fly on to the last drop of blood and the last drop of fuel, to the last beat of the heart."
-- Baron Manfred von Richthofen"/> <entry name="Aircraft0Properties" value="Airborne light mechanical"/>
<entry name="Aircraft1Properties" value="Airborne heavy mechanical"/>
<entry name="Aircraft2Properties" value="Airborne heavy mechanical"/>
<entry name="ATV0Description" value="Despite the similarities between Pandora and old Earth, tweaking properties like mass and moment of inertia for a light reconnaissance vehicle can mean the difference between life and death to its driver. The reported top speed for certain Xenomorph species is above 150 miles per hour, and in military circles exploration duty has become a sanction for disobedience.
Roger Raynor and his Seeker trike are legendary among explorers, his adventures often told in bars and at campfires: How he outwitted a great worm by driving in circles, how he stole Vermillion's golden scarab escaping through the sea of grass, and how he tried to outrun a pack of black Xenomorphs."/> <entry name="ATV0Properties" value="Light mechanical"/>
<entry name="ATV1Properties" value="Light mechanical"/>

<entry name="Mech0Description" value="The tank, up to now our heaviest war machine on the ground, is fairly restricted in size due to maneuver limitations in rough terrain. Finally the time has come for a new era of mechanization:
The Goliath is a gigantic humanoid war machine with a total weight of over a hundred thousand tons, wielding unrivaled fire power to engage whole armies. The bipedal movement allows him to excel in rough terrain, and he can equip even the heaviest weapon modules."/> <entry name="Mech0Properties" value="Heavy mechanical"/>
<entry name="Mech1Properties" value="Heavy mechanical"/>
<entry name="Mech2Properties" value="Heavy mechanical"/>
<entry name="Tank0Description" value="War machinery brought along from the old world is limited, so in order to defend ourselves against the planet's dangerous native lifeforms as well as other factions, we have to initiate the construction of mankind's most feared field weapon: the tank.
As heavy, metal monsters of death and destruction, tanks often have the last word on the battlefield. They can be configured with several different types of turrets, allowing a high level of specialization.
"Roll over them.""/> <entry name="Tank0Properties" value="Heavy mechanical"/>
<entry name="Tank1Properties" value="Heavy mechanical"/>
<entry name="Tank2Description" value="Over the past decades our understanding of the man-machine interface has progressed significantly, but only by studying the alien invaders war machinery we have finally mastered the technology of an organic interface: A complete symbiosis between man and machine.
"Tell me, Commander, how does it feel to become one with your tank?"
"Liberating.""/> <entry name="Tank2Properties" value="Heavy mechanical"/>
<entry name="TransportProperties" value="Heavy mechanical
Transports land units"/>
<entry name="Trooper0Description" value="The first line of defense in most Human worlds and trained for a variety of combat scenarios, Colonial Troopers are the backbone of modern armies.
"Give me ten troopers and a week, and I will change the course of history.""/> <entry name="Trooper0Properties" value="Light biological"/>
<entry name="Trooper1Description" value="Mobile and agile, but highly armored - the soldier of the future. The reinforced full body suit can withstand a considerable amount of onslaught, but thanks to internal pressure sensors grants the wearer fast and responsive motion control.
When field tested in a city warfare scenario, a young lieutenant named Wilkins, last of his squad, took out three enemy Avenger tanks by himself. The story spread like wildfire through the ranks, and "pulling a Wilkins" has become a synonym for effectively destroying tanks."/> <entry name="Trooper1Properties" value="Light biological"/>
<entry name="Trooper1ShockProperties" value="Light biological"/>
